title: Xi Tang Lin
text:

It’s a place for me to learn Quatro and showcase my learning.
Please take a look around.

Created website with Index, About, and CV pages.
Uploaded Website to github.

title: CV
text:
Accounting Coordinator | Apr 2024 - Aug 2025
Metro Ontario - Toronto, Ontario, Canada

Investigated and identified an issue with unorganized physical invoices, resulting in difficulty locating files and potential fire hazards. Informed supervisors and rolled out a new system to increase efficiency for a team of 20+ employees and ensure compliance with fire safety regulations.
Developed automations to increase work efficiency, saving multiple hours on weekly tasks.

title: CV
section: Math Program Coordinator & Instructor | Oct 2020 - Oct 2022
text:
Math Program Coordinator & Instructor | Oct 2020 - Oct 2022
Explorer Robotics Club - Toronto, Ontario, Canada

Simplified and explained mathematical concepts to students through engaging activities. Recognized for inspiring student enthusiasm and improving assessment performance by 20% over 2 years.

title: CV
text:
Area Director | Oct 2023 - Jun 2024
District 60 Toastmasters - Toronto, Ontario, Canada - Supported five clubs’ leadership teams by connecting them to district resources, organizing joint events, and collaborating to solve problems, helping them serve 100+ members.
Educational Program Manager | Jan 2022 - Dec 2024 University of Toronto Toastmasters - Toronto, Ontario, Canada

Facilitated public speaking workshops for various student and volunteer organizations by eliciting stakeholder needs, coordinating with presenters, and performing other ad-hoc tasks, resulting in over a dozen presentations impacting several hundred attendees.

title: CV

text:
Honors Bachelor of Science (Statistics, Economics, and Philosophy)
University of Toronto - Toronto, Ontario, Canada

Developed a broad range of rigorous quantitative, systematic and logical problem-solving abilities through interdisciplinary coursework.

title: About
text:
Hi, my name is Tan!
I’m an international student from Canada working towards my Master’s of Science in Statistics and Data Science at the University of Texas at Dallas.
You can often find me rock climbing, playing badminton, learning to dance, or reading a book.
One thing that changed my life was joining Toastmasters, a public speaking club.
After graduating, I plan on launching a career as a data scientist.

title: Assignment1
text:
This website was created with RStudio Quarto.
The Minty theme was used to create a professional look. The navigation bar includes 4 links, including a nested assignments tab, for connecting to different areas of my content.
I learned to add images, use code chunks, and different formatting tricks (.css styles, themes, nested menus, and footers)
Everything was going smoothly until I ran into an issue with publishing on GitHub related to building the page. I did some to research in an attempt to fix it. I eventually managed to fix it by setting up a Jekyll configuration (of some sort).
I thought I was done but a group member ran into the same problem so I helped them fix it and posted on Teams in-case others were encountering the same issue.

Iris Plot

title: Podcast Review 1
text: “Master Your Inner Game to Avoid Burnout with Klaus Kleinfeld, Former CEO at Alcoa and Siemens”, is an episode of DataFramed, a weekly podcast about data and technology. Hosted by co-hosts Adel Nehme and Richie Cotton, they facilitate discussions with data science leaders, distilling insights and ideas for a broader audience. The episode emphasizes the importance of the internal mental game, in addition to external strategies, providing relatable and applicable mental tools for managing your energy and purpose with the end goal of business and life success. Despite its valuable content my favorable opinion is tainted by its lack of focus and clear actionable steps for growth, ## Managing Energy “Because a lot of people think the emotion is something that is imposed on you” - Kleinfeld (Cotton R,, 2025, 10:30). In the podcast, Kleinfeld provides various strategies for managing one’s energy like looking for the upside, rejecting others’ spreading of negative emotions, and reframing fear as taking false expectations as reality. While Kleinfeld makes good points on managing energy, the delivery of his message, a scattered collection of anecdotes and loosely supported claims, leaves the listener without a clear recommendation on achieving this. A more helpful and focused podcast would greater benefit its audience by emphasizing a specific tool instead of flooding them with whatever comes to mind. ## Productive Downtime Similar to the previous section, the podcast would be elevated by incorporating more forethought into the structure of its information. As podcasts often are, it’s a natural conversation which is better served to entertain and provide a façade of knowledge instead of deep intellectual development. However, I do agree with the message provided: that rest and downtime is critical to avoiding burnout and maintaining energy. ## Purpose-Driven Leadership The section about leadership and purpose was intriguing. Discussing the competing priorities of business performance and culture, choosing people with purpose, and maintaining one’s own purpose. It offers a few relevant questions for listeners to consider, effectively prompting reflection. Unfortunately, listeners would have benefitted from more practical actions to take for choosing between competing priorities, discerning the right people, and staying true to one’s purpose. ## Conclusion While I believe the podcast makes important points and shares useful information, the nature of its scattered delivery and shallow depth obstructs it from being more than a feel good motivator for most listeners. However, it does act as a useful reminder regarding the importance of having strong internal strategies for developing a resilient mindset for avoiding burnout. # References Cotton R. (Host). (2025, September 1) Master Your Inner Game to Avoid Burnout with Klaus Kleinfeld, Former CEO at Alcoa and Siemens. Dataframed. https://www.datacamp.com/
